summary: HHS oversees the federal Community Services Block Grant program, which provides about $700 million in grants to states. In turn, the states provide funding to and oversee more than 1,000 local agencies. These agencies offer a range of services to address the program’s three goals: reducing poverty, promoting self-sufficiency, and revitalizing low-income communities. Although HHS uses state data for insight into the program’s performance, it...
title: Community Services Block Grant: Better Alignment of Outcome Measures with Program Goals Could Help Assess National Effectiveness
